content.description: Starts by walking up the slab, gain some footing and a good hand to reach above to the crack rail in the middle of the face. Match, gain a high foot and move up and right to the arete above. Mantle directly up the middle of the boulder. Tall, delicate but not too difficult. A fall could be very bad news so pad up.
content.protection: Several pads, a spotter and good practice falling.
content.location: Found towards the very top of Lunar hill, hidden behind some other large boulders. Coordinates are 33.224444, -116.450556. Boulder faces north-northwest. One of the tallest boulders on the hill, and the top is visible from the lookout.

content.description: Striking and obvious line on the south side of the hill. Starts low on the right arete of the boulder, climbs straight up and mantles at the horn. Mantle is a little spooky due to the rock sloping back down the backside of the boulder.
content.location: On the south side of Lunar Hill, faces north/north-west. Coordinates are 33.224444, -116.450833. This boulder is tall, skinny and sharp and is visible from a distance.
